stems_affixes.value_cn: 相符的, 一致的, 根据……而定的
stems_affixes.word_buile: accord[n.&v.一致;符合]+ing形容词→adj.相符的, 一致的, 根据……而定的
cord心脏,一致+ial……的→adj.首要的,主要的
accord[n.&v.一致;符合]+ance表名词→n.一致,和谐,符合
cordial[adj.首要的,主要的]+ity表名词→n.诚心,热诚
discord[n.不和;不一致]+ance表名词→n.不协调;　不一致
ac加强+cord心脏,一致→心心相符
re一再+cord心脏,一致→一再放在心上→记录

sentence.en: Inventors have been trying to make flying cars since the 1930s,  according to Robert Mann,  an airline industry expert.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

lj.lj_ly: According to my watch it is 4 o'clock.

entry.def: An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement, for example to end a war.
entry.tran: （国家、团体之间的正式）协定，协议，条约

example.ex: ...a fitting way to celebrate the peace accord.
example.tran: 庆祝和平协定的恰当的方式

entry.def: If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act towards you or treat you in that way.

example.ex: His predecessor was accorded an equally tumultuous welcome...
example.tran: 他的前任受到了同样热烈的欢迎。

example.ex: The government accorded him the rank of Colonel...

entry.def: If one fact, idea, or condition accords with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them.

example.ex: Such an approach accords with the principles of socialist ideology.
example.tran: 这种方法与社会主义意识形态的原则相符。

example.ex: ...scientific evidence that did not fully accord with the facts uncovered by the police.
example.tran: 与警方所掌握的情况不完全一致的科学证据

entry.def: If one person, action, or fact is in accord with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them. You can also say that two people or things are in accord.

example.ex: ...this military action, taken in accord with United Nations resolutions...
example.tran: 依据联合国决议而采取的本次军事行动

example.ex: Old enemies can become new friends even if all their national interests are not in complete accord.
example.tran: 即使国家利益不尽相同，他们也可以化敌为友。

entry.def: If something happens of its own accord, it seems to happen by itself, without anyone making it happen.

example.ex: In many cases the disease will clear up of its own accord.
example.tran: 这种病很多情况下会自愈。

entry.def: If you do something of your own accord, you do it because you want to, without being asked or forced.

example.ex: He did not quit as France's prime minister of his own accord.
example.tran: 他辞去法国总理职务并非出于自愿。

entry.def: If a number of people do something with one accord, they do it together or at the same time, because they agree about what should be done.

example.ex: With one accord they turned and walked back over the grass.
example.tran: 他们步调一致地转身走过草坪。

means.word_mean: 1. (followed by `to') as reported or stated by;
2. (followed by `to') in agreement with or accordant with;

sentences.cn: 根据估价员的估计, 火灾损失并不严重.
sentences.en: According to the assessor's statement, the fire damage was not severe.

sentences.cn: 我们原想买比这个大些的房子,但是得量力而为呀.
sentences.en: We wanted to buy a bigger house than this but we had to cut our coat according to our cloth.

sentences.cn: 据消息灵通人士透露, 收购建议计划在下月作出.
sentences.en: According to informed sources, a takeover bid is planned for next month.

sentences.cn: 据古代传说, 这条河是位女神.
sentences.en: According to ancient legend, the river is a goddess.

sentences.cn: 他听收音机校准了他的表.
sentences.en: He regulated his watch according to the radio.

sentences.cn: 根据我们的记录,你曾入狱三次.
sentences.en: You've been in prison three times according to our records.

sentences.cn: 据我所知, 下周将进行一次郊游.
sentences.en: According to what I have learnt, we are going to have an outing next week.

sentences.cn: 宇宙飞船按计划在15时30分起飞.
sentences.en: The spaceshipblasted off at 15:30 according to the plan.

sentences.cn: 任务已如期完成.
sentences.en: The task has been accomplished according to schedule.

sentences.cn: 他所采取的行动,根据怨言的性质,而有所不同.
sentences.en: The action he takes varies according to the nature of the complaint.

sentences.cn: 他将受到应有的惩罚.
sentences.en: He will be punished according to his deserts.

sentences.cn: 一切都按计划发展.
sentences.en: Everything has worked out according to plan.

sentences.cn: 据估计, 20个人中有19个人可程度不同地被催眠,如果他们想被催眠并相信催眠的人.
sentences.en: According to one estimate, about 19 in 20 people can be hypnotizd to some degree if they want to be and if they trust the hypnotist.

sentences.cn: 按照你的营养标准来衡量这食物 怎么样 ?
sentences.en: How does the food here measure up according to your nutrition standards?

sentences.cn: 领子是根据流行的款式剪成的.
sentences.en: The collar was cut away according to the fashion.

sentences.cn: 参加者按年龄分组。
sentences.en: Participants were categorized according to age.

sentences.cn: 图书馆的书按学科分类。
sentences.en: The books in the library are classified according to subject.

sentences.cn: 按法律规定，场边必须有一名医生。
sentences.en: According to law, a doctor must be present at the ringside.

sentences.cn: 按照迷信的说法，摔碎镜子会带来噩运。
sentences.en: According to superstition, breaking a mirror brings bad luck.

sentences.cn: 根据最新的民意测验，有50％的人反对，35％的人赞成。
sentences.en: According to the latest opinion polls, the noes have 50 percent, the yeses 35 percent.

sentences.cn: 根据所需剂量的浓度不同，每颗胶囊里含有30至100个吗啡硫酸盐颗粒。
sentences.en: Each capsule contains between 30 and 100 pellets of morphine sulphate according to the strength of dose required.

sentences.cn: 根据轮流担任领导的新政党章程，他们在一年后会轮换职位。
sentences.en: They will swap posts in a year's time, according to new party rules which rotate the leadership.

sentences.cn: 根据控方意见，官员们精心编造了事情经过。
sentences.en: According to the prosecution, the officers manufactured an elaborate story.

sentences.cn: 我的朋友说我是全天下最酷、最瘦、最聪明、最幽默的记者。
sentences.en: According to my friends I am the coolest, thinnest, cleverest, funniest journalist in the universe.

sentences.cn: 据警方称，亨特夫妇被发现死在家里厨房的地板上。
sentences.en: According to police accounts, Mr and Mrs Hunt were found dead on the floor of their kitchen.

sentences.en: According to the army, the teenager said he was on a "suicide mission" for the movement.

sentences.cn: 据传，她当时大声宣布，即使有再大的暴风雨她也要骑到终点。
sentences.en: According to the legend, she cried out that no storm was going to stop her from finishing her ride.

sentences.cn: 酒税税额随酒瓶容量的大小而有所不同。

sentences.en: Content of transaction , punishment, and criminal responsibility according to law and administrative regulations.

sentences.en: Distribution channels can be set up according to your company's market strategy or internal organization.

Sentence.sentence: "It is a thing of no great difficulty," according to Plutarch," to raise objections against another man's speech, it is a very easy matter; but to produce a better in its place is a work extremely troublesome."
Sentence.come: 2015年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: According to a German professor, the soreness comes from straining your muscles in an uncommon way, for example, jumping on a bicycle for a ride, because you haven't ridden in a long time.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: According to a new Pew Research Center survey on women and leadership, most Americans find women indistinguishable from men on key leadership traits such as intelligence and capacity for innovation, with many saying they're stronger than men in terms of b
Sentence.come: 2019年6月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: According to a new study from Cornell University's Food and BrandLab, small nonfood rewards—like the toys in McDonald's Happy Meals—stimulate the same reward centers in the brain as food does.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月四级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: According to a newly published study, cats seem to be able to predict the location of hiding prey (猎物) using both their ears and an inborn (天生的) understanding of how the physical world works.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: According to an urban design professor, it is difficult for city designers to foresee what happen in the future.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: According to Charles Harper, chairman of ConAgra, the Healthy Choice line of frozen dinners began with his own heart attack.

Sentence.sentence: According to data released in January 2017, 56 percent of bills are paid online, which means that just under half of payments still rely on delivery services to be completed.

Sentence.sentence: According to one professor, obesity is related to a lack of basic awareness of nutrition and health.
